summary:
## FBI: Protecting America at Home and Abroad

The FBI is the main law enforcement agency in the United States. It protects national security, fights crime, and investigates federal law violations. 

While mostly focused on domestic issues, the FBI also works internationally, coordinating with other countries' security services and sometimes conducting secret operations.

Established in 1908, it's now headquartered in Washington, D.C., and has offices across the U.S. and around the world.
title: Federal Bureau of Investigation
